name: K2-219
scenarioDescription:
The K2-219 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-219 is a star with 1.02 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-219 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-219 system


K2-219 b

K2-219 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-219 b is 2.385 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-219 b is 1.348 that of Earth. At 2.385 Earth masses, K2-219 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-219 d was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-219 d is 7.154999999999999 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-219 d is 2.576 that of Earth. At 7.154999999999999 Earth masses, K2-219 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
